location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 840 of 1824 from William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay to Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter concerns two boats from Sharga [Sharjah] that the British suspect of being involved in a piratical act. It encloses a copy of a letter from George Swinton, Secretary to the Government of Fort William, Calcutta to William Newnham dated 25 June 1824. The enclosed communication provides instructions indicating what to do with the offenders in the event of their capture by British ships; the officers in question should consider the degree of evidence against them, which should determine who they will be surrendered to.
